    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          Comment 14<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1395257#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="OOO till Jan 2nd" hidden="">schedule</i>
      ajuma@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/1702376237" title="ajuma@chromium.org"><!---->ajuma@chromium.org<!----></a>
      ajuma@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->ajuma@chromium.org<!----></span>
      OOO till Jan 2nd<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="OOO till Jan 2nd" hidden=""><!---->OOO till Jan 2nd<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Thu, Dec 8, 2022, 5:55 PM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Dec 8, 2022, 5:55 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1395257#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Dec 8, 2022, 5:55 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1395257#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Dec 8, 2022, 5:55 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I debugged this a bit using a (non-ASan) trunk build of WebKit, to try to better understand why we're crashing.<span class="line"><!---->I debugged this a bit using a (non-ASan) trunk build of WebKit, to try to better understand why we're crashing.<!----></span><br><br>It turns out that WebKit uses pointer compression on Arm64, expecting pointers to be 16-byte aligned so that their last 4 bits can be dropped (since they're all zero).<span class="line"><!---->It turns out that WebKit uses pointer compression on Arm64, expecting pointers to be 16-byte aligned so that their last 4 bits can be dropped (since they're all zero).<!----></span><br><br>But when running with ASan, ASan's __sanitizer_mz_malloc intercepts allocations, and seems to be returning pointers that don't meet this requirement. This breaks pointer compression, which triggers an assertion in debug builds, and will cause crashes in non-debug builds since decoded pointers will not match the raw pointer that was encoded.<span class="line"><!---->But when running with ASan, ASan's __sanitizer_mz_malloc intercepts allocations, and seems to be returning pointers that don't meet this requirement. This breaks pointer compression, which triggers an assertion in debug builds, and will cause crashes in non-debug builds since decoded pointers will not match the raw pointer that was encoded.<!----></span><br><br>So I think this is not an actual security bug, but rather a mismatch between __sanitizer_mz_malloc and what WebKit expects from the default allocator.<span class="line"><!---->So I think this is not an actual security bug, but rather a mismatch between __sanitizer_mz_malloc and what WebKit expects from the default allocator.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2"></mr-comment>
      
      
      
        
          Comment 15<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1395257#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="OOO till Jan 2nd" hidden="">schedule</i>
      ajuma@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/1702376237" title="ajuma@chromium.org"><!---->ajuma@chromium.org<!----></a>
      ajuma@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->ajuma@chromium.org<!----></span>
      OOO till Jan 2nd<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="OOO till Jan 2nd" hidden=""><!---->OOO till Jan 2nd<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Fri, Dec 9, 2022, 11:32 AM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Dec 9, 2022, 11:32 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1395257#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Dec 9, 2022, 11:32 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1395257#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Dec 9, 2022, 11:32 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          ASan incorrectly uses 64-bit allocator on iOS
          (was: Memory corruption in WKContentRuleListProvider)
          <br>
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          ajuma@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          -ajuma@chromium.org michaeldo@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam -Security_Severity-Medium -Security_Impact-Beta -ReleaseBlock-Stable
          
          <br>
        
          NextAction:<strong><!---->NextAction:</strong>
          
          2022-12-19
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          ASan incorrectly uses 64-bit allocator on iOS
          (was: Memory corruption in WKContentRuleListProvider)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          ajuma@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          -ajuma@chromium.org michaeldo@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam -Security_Severity-Medium -Security_Impact-Beta -ReleaseBlock-Stable
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->NextAction:</strong>
          
          2022-12-19
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Debugging some more, the reason that pointer compression is failing is that on iOS, pointers are expected to fit within 36-bits, but __sanitizer_mz_malloc is returning larger pointer values. As a result, pointer compression into a 32-bit int is lossy, and we get garbage pointers when decompressing these values.<span class="line"><!---->Debugging some more, the reason that pointer compression is failing is that on iOS, pointers are expected to fit within 36-bits, but __sanitizer_mz_malloc is returning larger pointer values. As a result, pointer compression into a 32-bit int is lossy, and we get garbage pointers when decompressing these values.<!----></span><br><br>I bisected this crash to an llvm roll (<span class="line"><!---->I bisected this crash to an llvm roll (<!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4021909<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4021909"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4021909<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> which includes a change (<span class="line"><!----> which includes a change (<!----></span>https://reviews.llvm.org/D137136<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://reviews.llvm.org/D137136"><!---->https://reviews.llvm.org/D137136<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> to use the 64-bit version of the allocator on ARM64, and this is almost certainly the cause of the regression. A fix recently landed (<span class="line"><!----> to use the 64-bit version of the allocator on ARM64, and this is almost certainly the cause of the regression. A fix recently landed (<!----></span>https://reviews.llvm.org/D139030<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://reviews.llvm.org/D139030"><!---->https://reviews.llvm.org/D139030<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> which goes back to using the 32-bit allocator on iOS. This change should be pulled in the next time we roll llvm, and I'd expect this crash to be fixed then.<span class="line"><!----> which goes back to using the 32-bit allocator on iOS. This change should be pulled in the next time we roll llvm, and I'd expect this crash to be fixed then.<!----></span><br><br>Since this is not a real security bug but instead a bug in ASan, I'm going to remove the security labels and RBS, and set a NextAction date to test again after the next llvm roll.<span class="line"><!---->Since this is not a real security bug but instead a bug in ASan, I'm going to remove the security labels and RBS, and set a NextAction date to test again after the next llvm roll.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          <div class="edit-actions">
            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">
              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      </label>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));

        mr-launch-overview {

            <div class="container-issue-content">
              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {

  * appropriate heading levels.

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-keystrokes></mr-keystrokes>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          Comment 14<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1395257#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="OOO till Jan 2nd" hidden="">schedule</i>
      ajuma@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/1702376237" title="ajuma@chromium.org"><!---->ajuma@chromium.org<!----></a>
      ajuma@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->ajuma@chromium.org<!----></span>
      OOO till Jan 2nd<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="OOO till Jan 2nd" hidden=""><!---->OOO till Jan 2nd<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Thu, Dec 8, 2022, 5:55 PM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Dec 8, 2022, 5:55 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1395257#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Dec 8, 2022, 5:55 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1395257#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Dec 8, 2022, 5:55 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I debugged this a bit using a (non-ASan) trunk build of WebKit, to try to better understand why we're crashing.<span class="line"><!---->I debugged this a bit using a (non-ASan) trunk build of WebKit, to try to better understand why we're crashing.<!----></span><br><br>It turns out that WebKit uses pointer compression on Arm64, expecting pointers to be 16-byte aligned so that their last 4 bits can be dropped (since they're all zero).<span class="line"><!---->It turns out that WebKit uses pointer compression on Arm64, expecting pointers to be 16-byte aligned so that their last 4 bits can be dropped (since they're all zero).<!----></span><br><br>But when running with ASan, ASan's __sanitizer_mz_malloc intercepts allocations, and seems to be returning pointers that don't meet this requirement. This breaks pointer compression, which triggers an assertion in debug builds, and will cause crashes in non-debug builds since decoded pointers will not match the raw pointer that was encoded.<span class="line"><!---->But when running with ASan, ASan's __sanitizer_mz_malloc intercepts allocations, and seems to be returning pointers that don't meet this requirement. This breaks pointer compression, which triggers an assertion in debug builds, and will cause crashes in non-debug builds since decoded pointers will not match the raw pointer that was encoded.<!----></span><br><br>So I think this is not an actual security bug, but rather a mismatch between __sanitizer_mz_malloc and what WebKit expects from the default allocator.<span class="line"><!---->So I think this is not an actual security bug, but rather a mismatch between __sanitizer_mz_malloc and what WebKit expects from the default allocator.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2"></mr-comment>
      
      
      
        
          Comment 15<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1395257#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="OOO till Jan 2nd" hidden="">schedule</i>
      ajuma@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/1702376237" title="ajuma@chromium.org"><!---->ajuma@chromium.org<!----></a>
      ajuma@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->ajuma@chromium.org<!----></span>
      OOO till Jan 2nd<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="OOO till Jan 2nd" hidden=""><!---->OOO till Jan 2nd<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Fri, Dec 9, 2022, 11:32 AM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Dec 9, 2022, 11:32 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1395257#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Dec 9, 2022, 11:32 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1395257#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Dec 9, 2022, 11:32 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          ASan incorrectly uses 64-bit allocator on iOS
          (was: Memory corruption in WKContentRuleListProvider)
          <br>
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          ajuma@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          -ajuma@chromium.org michaeldo@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam -Security_Severity-Medium -Security_Impact-Beta -ReleaseBlock-Stable
          
          <br>
        
          NextAction:<strong><!---->NextAction:</strong>
          
          2022-12-19
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          ASan incorrectly uses 64-bit allocator on iOS
          (was: Memory corruption in WKContentRuleListProvider)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          ajuma@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          -ajuma@chromium.org michaeldo@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam -Security_Severity-Medium -Security_Impact-Beta -ReleaseBlock-Stable
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->NextAction:</strong>
          
          2022-12-19
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Debugging some more, the reason that pointer compression is failing is that on iOS, pointers are expected to fit within 36-bits, but __sanitizer_mz_malloc is returning larger pointer values. As a result, pointer compression into a 32-bit int is lossy, and we get garbage pointers when decompressing these values.<span class="line"><!---->Debugging some more, the reason that pointer compression is failing is that on iOS, pointers are expected to fit within 36-bits, but __sanitizer_mz_malloc is returning larger pointer values. As a result, pointer compression into a 32-bit int is lossy, and we get garbage pointers when decompressing these values.<!----></span><br><br>I bisected this crash to an llvm roll (<span class="line"><!---->I bisected this crash to an llvm roll (<!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4021909<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4021909"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4021909<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> which includes a change (<span class="line"><!----> which includes a change (<!----></span>https://reviews.llvm.org/D137136<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://reviews.llvm.org/D137136"><!---->https://reviews.llvm.org/D137136<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> to use the 64-bit version of the allocator on ARM64, and this is almost certainly the cause of the regression. A fix recently landed (<span class="line"><!----> to use the 64-bit version of the allocator on ARM64, and this is almost certainly the cause of the regression. A fix recently landed (<!----></span>https://reviews.llvm.org/D139030<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://reviews.llvm.org/D139030"><!---->https://reviews.llvm.org/D139030<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> which goes back to using the 32-bit allocator on iOS. This change should be pulled in the next time we roll llvm, and I'd expect this crash to be fixed then.<span class="line"><!----> which goes back to using the 32-bit allocator on iOS. This change should be pulled in the next time we roll llvm, and I'd expect this crash to be fixed then.<!----></span><br><br>Since this is not a real security bug but instead a bug in ASan, I'm going to remove the security labels and RBS, and set a NextAction date to test again after the next llvm roll.<span class="line"><!---->Since this is not a real security bug but instead a bug in ASan, I'm going to remove the security labels and RBS, and set a NextAction date to test again after the next llvm roll.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

        Setting some security labels here. As this is an OOB read, we'd normally mark it as Medium severity. Our iOS architecture is a bit unusual but I think that still fits. I'm saying FoundIn-109 based on <span class="line"><!---->Setting some security labels here. As this is an OOB read, we'd normally mark it as Medium severity. Our iOS architecture is a bit unusual but I think that still fits. I'm saying FoundIn-109 based on <!----></span>#c0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c0"><!---->#c0<!----></a>: ajuma@, that means Sheriffbot will assume this is a security regression in M109 and may block M109 stable release. I assume that actually this problem exists since earlier, so please add FoundIn-108 if that's the case.<span class="line"><!---->: ajuma@, that means Sheriffbot will assume this is a security regression in M109 and may block M109 stable release. I assume that actually this problem exists since earlier, so please add FoundIn-108 if that's the case.<!----></span><br><br>For now, we'll treat it as a security bug on the assumption that this might be something in the way we're using Apple's APIs. If it becomes clear that it's an Apple bug I assume we'll flip the status here to ExternalDependency and sheriffbot will stop fretting about this bug.<span class="line"><!---->For now, we'll treat it as a security bug on the assumption that this might be something in the way we're using Apple's APIs. If it becomes clear that it's an Apple bug I assume we'll flip the status here to ExternalDependency and sheriffbot will stop fretting about this bug.<!----></span><br><br>There's also the question about whether this is exploitable. If this code path can't be triggered by an attacker at all because it only ever happens on startup then we can probably reclassify this as type=Bug.<span class="line"><!---->There's also the question about whether this is exploitable. If this code path can't be triggered by an attacker at all because it only ever happens on startup then we can probably reclassify this as type=Bug.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<span class="line"><!---->This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<!----></span><br><br>If this doesn't affect a release branch, or has not been properly classified for severity, please update the Security_Impact or Security_Severity labels, and remove the ReleaseBlock label. To disable this altogether, apply ReleaseBlock-NA.<span class="line"><!---->If this doesn't affect a release branch, or has not been properly classified for severity, please update the Security_Impact or Security_Severity labels, and remove the ReleaseBlock label. To disable this altogether, apply ReleaseBlock-NA.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 14<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1395257#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="OOO till Jan 2nd" hidden="">schedule</i>
      ajuma@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/1702376237" title="ajuma@chromium.org"><!---->ajuma@chromium.org<!----></a>
      ajuma@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->ajuma@chromium.org<!----></span>
      OOO till Jan 2nd<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="OOO till Jan 2nd" hidden=""><!---->OOO till Jan 2nd<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Thu, Dec 8, 2022, 5:55 PM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Dec 8, 2022, 5:55 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1395257#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Dec 8, 2022, 5:55 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1395257#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Dec 8, 2022, 5:55 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I debugged this a bit using a (non-ASan) trunk build of WebKit, to try to better understand why we're crashing.<span class="line"><!---->I debugged this a bit using a (non-ASan) trunk build of WebKit, to try to better understand why we're crashing.<!----></span><br><br>It turns out that WebKit uses pointer compression on Arm64, expecting pointers to be 16-byte aligned so that their last 4 bits can be dropped (since they're all zero).<span class="line"><!---->It turns out that WebKit uses pointer compression on Arm64, expecting pointers to be 16-byte aligned so that their last 4 bits can be dropped (since they're all zero).<!----></span><br><br>But when running with ASan, ASan's __sanitizer_mz_malloc intercepts allocations, and seems to be returning pointers that don't meet this requirement. This breaks pointer compression, which triggers an assertion in debug builds, and will cause crashes in non-debug builds since decoded pointers will not match the raw pointer that was encoded.<span class="line"><!---->But when running with ASan, ASan's __sanitizer_mz_malloc intercepts allocations, and seems to be returning pointers that don't meet this requirement. This breaks pointer compression, which triggers an assertion in debug builds, and will cause crashes in non-debug builds since decoded pointers will not match the raw pointer that was encoded.<!----></span><br><br>So I think this is not an actual security bug, but rather a mismatch between __sanitizer_mz_malloc and what WebKit expects from the default allocator.<span class="line"><!---->So I think this is not an actual security bug, but rather a mismatch between __sanitizer_mz_malloc and what WebKit expects from the default allocator.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2"></mr-comment>
      
      
      
        
          Comment 15<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1395257#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="OOO till Jan 2nd" hidden="">schedule</i>
      ajuma@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/1702376237" title="ajuma@chromium.org"><!---->ajuma@chromium.org<!----></a>
      ajuma@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->ajuma@chromium.org<!----></span>
      OOO till Jan 2nd<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="OOO till Jan 2nd" hidden=""><!---->OOO till Jan 2nd<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Fri, Dec 9, 2022, 11:32 AM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Dec 9, 2022, 11:32 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1395257#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Dec 9, 2022, 11:32 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1395257#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Dec 9, 2022, 11:32 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          ASan incorrectly uses 64-bit allocator on iOS
          (was: Memory corruption in WKContentRuleListProvider)
          <br>
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          ajuma@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          -ajuma@chromium.org michaeldo@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam -Security_Severity-Medium -Security_Impact-Beta -ReleaseBlock-Stable
          
          <br>
        
          NextAction:<strong><!---->NextAction:</strong>
          
          2022-12-19
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          ASan incorrectly uses 64-bit allocator on iOS
          (was: Memory corruption in WKContentRuleListProvider)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          ajuma@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          -ajuma@chromium.org michaeldo@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam -Security_Severity-Medium -Security_Impact-Beta -ReleaseBlock-Stable
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->NextAction:</strong>
          
          2022-12-19
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Debugging some more, the reason that pointer compression is failing is that on iOS, pointers are expected to fit within 36-bits, but __sanitizer_mz_malloc is returning larger pointer values. As a result, pointer compression into a 32-bit int is lossy, and we get garbage pointers when decompressing these values.<span class="line"><!---->Debugging some more, the reason that pointer compression is failing is that on iOS, pointers are expected to fit within 36-bits, but __sanitizer_mz_malloc is returning larger pointer values. As a result, pointer compression into a 32-bit int is lossy, and we get garbage pointers when decompressing these values.<!----></span><br><br>I bisected this crash to an llvm roll (<span class="line"><!---->I bisected this crash to an llvm roll (<!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4021909<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4021909"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4021909<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> which includes a change (<span class="line"><!----> which includes a change (<!----></span>https://reviews.llvm.org/D137136<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://reviews.llvm.org/D137136"><!---->https://reviews.llvm.org/D137136<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> to use the 64-bit version of the allocator on ARM64, and this is almost certainly the cause of the regression. A fix recently landed (<span class="line"><!----> to use the 64-bit version of the allocator on ARM64, and this is almost certainly the cause of the regression. A fix recently landed (<!----></span>https://reviews.llvm.org/D139030<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://reviews.llvm.org/D139030"><!---->https://reviews.llvm.org/D139030<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> which goes back to using the 32-bit allocator on iOS. This change should be pulled in the next time we roll llvm, and I'd expect this crash to be fixed then.<span class="line"><!----> which goes back to using the 32-bit allocator on iOS. This change should be pulled in the next time we roll llvm, and I'd expect this crash to be fixed then.<!----></span><br><br>Since this is not a real security bug but instead a bug in ASan, I'm going to remove the security labels and RBS, and set a NextAction date to test again after the next llvm roll.<span class="line"><!---->Since this is not a real security bug but instead a bug in ASan, I'm going to remove the security labels and RBS, and set a NextAction date to test again after the next llvm roll.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
